list_definition.definition: a deepened part of a harbour/harbor etc where ships go for loading, unloading, repair etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The ship was in dock for three weeks.
He works down at the docks.

list_definition.definition: the box in a law court where the accused person sits or stands

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They put him in the dock for shoplifting.

list_definition.definition: to (cause to) enter a dock and tie up alongside a quay

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The liner docked in Southampton this morning.

list_definition.definition: to cut short or remove a part from

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The dog’s tail had been docked
His wages were docked to pay for the broken window.
